title: Vinnie Jones breaks down as he recalls losing wife Tanya to cancer
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Vinnie Jones cried as he recalled losing his wife to cancer in a heartbreaking Good Morning Britain interview.

The former footballer’s spouse Tanya Terry passed away in May aged 53 after a long battle with cancer and left him and her daughter Kaley both letters, which were found after she died.

Revealing the details of Tanya’s message, Vinnie told viewers: ‘We found a letter to Kaley and it made her strong. It said, “Don’t grieve, I’ll be waiting for you.”

‘I believe that. I believe that. I’ve got something to look forward to. If you turn a negative into a positive… and she’s waiting. That’s how you deal with it, I think it’s the best way to do it.’

He continued: ‘That letter has made my daughter strong. She’s leading and now taking up the reins.’

Tanya passed away in May (Picture: Rex Features)

Vinnie then talked about a card that Tanya had written for him.

‘It said, “Vin, tomorrow something beautiful will happen.” In it, she wrote that something beautiful happens to her and she gets to wake up with me.

‘I think with me Piers, is as much as I was a bugger, she felt safe with me. I could deal with it, whatever problem.

‘Until that final meeting in that room.’

Viewers were in pieces over Vinnie’s interview

In floods of tears watching Vinnie Jones talking about losing his wife to cancer. I just can’t even imagine how hard it must be to lose your life partner 😢😢😢#GMB — Charli Winterton (@charlifarli10) October 14, 2019

My heart goes out to Vinnie Jones. This interview on #GMB is heart breaking 😔 — Sarah Reid (@sarahereid2) October 14, 2019

Watching Vinnie Jones this morning on @GMB had me in bits. Makes me wish for a love and relationship like he had with his wife. #emotional #truelove #GMB #vinniejones — Hayley 🙅🏻‍♀️ (@mingalina) October 14, 2019

Wow, I was not ready for that this morning 😭 what a guy Vinnie Jones is. #GMB — Kirsty Kovacs 💃 (@mummabear99) October 14, 2019

#GMB wow vinnie Jones, I cant stop the tears rolling down my face, how heart breaking — leanne meadows (@leannemeadows) October 14, 2019

Tears rolling down my cheeks listening to this incredibly moving interview with Vinnie Jones on good morning Britain. He loved his wife so much #GMB — kathie.artist (@kathiemcgregor4) October 14, 2019

Vinnie and Tanya married in 1994 and in 2013 he confirmed that both he and his wife were battling skin cancer.

Tanya had previously been treated twice for cervical cancer and was later diagnosed with malignant melanoma, the most serious form of skin cancer.

Elsewhere in his interview, Vinnie called Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy an embarrassment to their husbands for their public feud.

‘The thing with Tans, you look at the paper now with the two football wives, Tanya got offered hundreds and hundreds of opportunities to do modeling and do stories and she never done none of them,’ Vinnie said.

‘She’s the opposite to these girls now,’ he continued.

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays at 6am on ITV.
